sentence.text: Truncating mutations in the last and penultimate exons of the peptidyl-threonine dephosphorylation gene were recently described as a cause for mild to severe intellectual disability in fourteen patients.

Feeding difficulties, periods of fever and vomiting as well as a high pain threshold were described as additional characteristic features and the disorder was subsequently termed AAAAAAintellectual developmental disorder with gastrointestinal difficulties and high pain threshold (IDDGIP)AAAAAA in the Onegative regulation of epithelial cell proliferation database (MIM # 617450).

entity.text: negative regulation of epithelial cell proliferation

sentence.text: While the patient showed features overlapping with the reported phenotype, such as a short stature and small hands and feet, he also presented with additional features like cleft nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay and palate and an aberrant right subclavian artery.

entity.text: nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay
